meta.title: Terms of Sale | Auriga Racing
meta.description: View Auriga Racing's terms of sale for our trackdays, events and services.

article1.title: 1. Purpose
article1.content: These general terms and conditions govern the sale of supervised driving sessions (trackdays) offered by Auriga ASBL, where participants use racing vehicles provided by the Organizer under the supervision of a professional coach.

article2.title: 2. Included Services
article2.content:
* Provision of a race car prepared for the track
* Personalized coaching by qualified instructors
* Provision of mandatory safety equipment:
  * Approved helmet with integrated communication system
  * HANS system with compatible attachments
  * Balaclava loaned for the day

Note:
The balaclava must be returned after the last session of the day
Any damage, loss or non-return of equipment (helmet, HANS, balaclava) will be charged to the participant at its replacement value

article3.title: 3. Participation Requirements
article3.content:
* Be at least 16 years old on the date of the event
* No driver's license required
* Be in good physical condition
* Wear the provided safety equipment during all driving phases
* Sign the liability waiver provided by the Organizer before participation

article4.title: 4. Event Proceedings
article4.content:
* The participant agrees to follow all instructions from coaches and supervisory staff
* Any dangerous driving, non-compliance with safety instructions, or inappropriate behavior may result in immediate exclusion from the event without possibility of refund

article5.title: 5. Personal Liability
article5.content:
* The participant acknowledges being fully aware of the risks associated with automobile driving on a circuit
* They expressly waive any recourse against the Organizer, its employees, partners, or suppliers for any bodily, material, or immaterial damage suffered during the event
* This waiver is formalized by the prior signing of the liability release

article6.title: 6. Vehicle Damage
article6.content:
* In case of damage to the provided vehicle, the participant will be systematically responsible for repairs, whether or not they caused the incident
* As the circuit is a private venue and considered a non-right place for automobile civil liability, no recourse between participants is possible
* The participant expressly agrees to cover all costs of restoring the vehicle unless they have subscribed to specific insurance (see article 7)
* This rule also applies in case of an incident involving a third party

article7.title: 7. Insurance
article7.content:
An optional insurance formula may be offered by the Organizer before the event:
* Rate: €125 excluding VAT per day
* Deductible: €1,000 excluding VAT
* Maximum coverage: €15,000 excluding VAT

In case of an incident, the participant remains responsible for the deductible amount as well as any damage exceeding the compensation ceiling.

Subscription to this insurance does not exempt the participant from the obligation to take all necessary precautions to preserve the integrity of the vehicle.

article8.title: 8. Rates and Payment Terms
article8.content:
* Rates are publicly displayed on the Organizer's website
* A deposit is required to confirm the reservation. The deposit amount is freely determined by the Organizer and specified at the time of reservation
* The balance of the total amount must be paid no later than 10 days before the trackday date

article9.title: 9. Cancellation and Refund
article9.content:
* In case of cancellation by the participant more than 30 days before the event: full refund
* In case of cancellation by the participant between 30 and 15 days before the event: 50% refund of the total amount
* In case of cancellation by the participant less than 15 days before the event: no refund
* In case of cancellation by the Organizer (extreme weather conditions, major technical problems, etc.): postponement of the event to a later date or full refund at the participant's choice

article10.title: 10. Applicable Law and Jurisdiction
article10.content:
* These general terms and conditions are subject to Belgian law
* Any dispute relating to their interpretation or execution falls under the exclusive jurisdiction of the Brussels courts
